conclusion: Predict which container D, E or F liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid starts from the orange source labeled A.
Liquid flows down in a straight line until it hits the horizontal purple baffle.
Liquid follows the path of least resistance and flows horizontally along the purple baffle.
Liquid continues to flow horizontally until it hits the next vertical baffle (cyan).
Liquid is deflected downward and flows into the container labeled E.
Liquid starts from the blue source labeled B.
Liquid flows down in a straight line until it hits the horizontal purple baffle.
Liquid follows the horizontal path of the purple baffle.
Liquid reaches the cyan baffle.
Liquid gets split into two streams.
One stream continues to flow horizontally and falls into the container labeled F.
The other stream is deflected downward and also falls into the container labeled F.
Liquid starts from the white source labeled C.
Liquid flows down in a straight line until it hits the diagonal baffle (brown).
Liquid is deflected by the brown baffle and flows to the right following the baffle's slope.
Liquid moves along the brown baffle.
Liquid eventually falls off and flows directly into the container labeled F.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid from B flows into container F.
Liquid from C flows into container F.
